intro: Hermannia scabra, commonly known as the rough hermannia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in dense inflorescences, and bloom during the rainy season. Hermannia scabra is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to semi-arid environments.
